comments:
I am using 3.0RC2. I was playing around with view filtering and working sets (in
the Package Explorer, Navigator View, Problems View and Tasks View). Even though
I did not have any tasks defined, I set the filtering in the task view to a java
working set I had created earlier. I then added "//TODOs" in my code, but the
tasks were not appearing even though matched the filter.  I removed the
filtering (set to "on any resource"). The tasks were still not showing up in the
Tasks view. I restarted eclipse and the Task view displayed: "An error has
occured when creating this view". I restarted eclipse one more time to have this
problem go away.

Below is the content of the log after restarting eclipse the first time:

Upping the severity.  That verify error scares me.

Ines please investigate this.  We need to know what the underlying compile 
error is caused by.. old code somewhere, incompatible plugins etc...

I can't seem to reproduce this problem, so I am still not sure what caused the
"java.lang.VerifyError" exception.
 
As Kim suggested, I looked at the classes involved in this bug, such as
"TextCellEditor", "CellEditor", "TaskView" and jface's utility class "Assert".
None of the latter classes have had significant changes within the past couple
of weeks. I am still investigating...

I just noticed that I made a typo in comment #0. I was using RC3, not RC2, when
this bug occurred.

Adding Stefan to the cc list as this is his component but assigning to Ines as 
she appears to be working on this currently.

I have not been able reproduce the problem. I will re-open if I run into this
problem again on the Mac.
